Evaluation_Questions: How well did this course, to the extent promised in the syllabus, enable “conversation across lines of difference,” integrate practical and theoretical concerns, or consider and integrate issues of class, gender/sexuality, race/ethnicity, dis/ability, and or global/cultural diversity
Comments_Questions: What was the name of your practicum instructor
What were her/his strengths or weaknesses
Comments_List: Bill Mathis is a good guy but he seems just as interested in himself, if not more so, as he is in helping students reflect on their experience. He likes to hear himself talk and preach even if its just to 6 students.
I've already written how much I like Tracy in the SurveyMonkey that went out.

Tracy was a great section leader.  She made everyone comfortable in part by sharing of herself and her own experiences as a minister, and she also made sure each person was comfortable at their own level of Supervised MInistry-related maturity - no matter where they were on their spiritual journey, no matter what their work abilities.  She was non judgmental but provided great guidance at the same time.  I only have great things to say about her.

Strengths:
Engaging
Encouraging
Interested in us.

Alison Cunningham is an excellent section leader. She encourages individual reflection and participation. Her section drew out the differences in our supervised ministry sites, and offered reflection on how to manage each of our challenges. She was excellent at enabling us to come together as a group, notwithstanding differences in our faith traditions or callings to ministry.
Experience and understanding of the issues brought to the table in class. A good listening ear and practical probing of the issues.
Very supportive and very flexible, Kyle is great

Alison was wonderful. She was really good at creating an environment that was really relaxing and easy without making it a meaningless group. She did a great job of making sure everyone was, kindly, challenged to show up, but did not push anyone uncomfortably. She did a really good job at challenging us to think theologically and corporately and critically about our experiences.
Very caring, lots of experience, great demeanor

Alison was amazing. She really made the space a useful one for me. I didn't really find the curriculum to be helpful. I was told that the course has not supposed to be 'academic', but the listed readings made it feel that way. I found the space to be most helpful in that in facilitated reflection on my internship experiences. That happened in the practicum, not as a result of readings. Alison's skillful facilitation of the group was the main reason this course was helpful.
Great presence in the room.  Open, inviting person.
thank you for the refreshments and pizza -- very thoughtful
